intro: Phacelia mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid environments, such as sand dunes and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert ecosystems. Phacelia mohavensis is also noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
